action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a plate and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
> open cupboard
Turn 1
The cupboard is now open. The cupboard is empty.
> take book from cupboard
Turn 2
You can't see a book here.
> take plate from counter
Turn 3
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
> put plate on table
Turn 4
You can't see a table here.
> go to living room
Turn 5
You are in a living room now. There are a table, a book, a shelf, a chair, a side table and a couch. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.
> take book from side table
Turn 6
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book and a plate.

> go to kitchen


> put book on table
Turn 7
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
> put plate on counter
Turn 8
You put the plate on the counter.

> take mop from pantry



> put mop on counter



> put book on counter



> done
Turn 9
You are not in a pantry.

> go to pantry


> take mop from pantry


> go to kitchen


> put mop on counter


> put book on counter


> done

You are in a pantry now. There are a refrigerator and a freezer. The refrigerator is closed. The freezer is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.

> go to kitchen


> put mop on counter


> put book on counter


> put plate on counter


> done
